means: 捐钱( endow的过去式和过去分词 )
使（某人）天生具有（好资质、能力等）

sentence.Network_en: The cross is endowed with a special meaning for Christians.
sentence.Network_cn: 对基督教徒来说,十字架被赋予了特殊意义.

sentence.Network_en: The rich businessman endowed the hospital with half his fortune.
sentence.Network_cn: 这位富商把他的一半财产捐赠给那所医院.

sentence.Network_en: This country is favourably endowed climatically.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个国家的气候得天独厚.

PerfectNetExp.abs: rich alumnus endowed the college with half of his fortune ., 这位富有的校友把其一半的财产捐赠给这所大学.
officially endowed with authority or power ., 正式得被赋予权威或者权力.
as far as Williams the theater vitality is endowed with the charm of poetic andthe style of concision and vividness to represent life .在威廉斯那里，戏剧的生命力在于赋予它以诗意的、令人浮想联翩的魅力，在于它对生活简洁而传神的表现上。

this could be simply a loose confederation or , alternatively , one comprising a central corps endowed with certain powers enabling it to arbitrate a loose confederation of sovereign states .这可能是一个松散的联盟，或者有一个中央军权赋予地方力量联盟仲裁主权国家。

list.abs: 字典中丰字的解释 ... (13) 丰厚;富裕[ be rich;thick] (15) 富饶[ richly endowed;fertile] (17) 豆器所盛丰富的[ abundant].
经济学英语词汇 - 豆丁网 ... initial condition 初始条件 initial endowment 初始禀赋 innovation 创新.
禀赋效应（Endowment effect）：总认为自己的东西是最好的。在交易的时候总觉得自己吃亏了。
原赋效应(Endowment Effect)对于要将某个东西卖出去，一般人所要求的价格通常比他们愿意花钱去买的价格来得高。造成原赋效应的 …
养老保险(Endowment Insurance)是国家依据相关法律法规规定,为解决劳动者在达到国家规定的解除劳动义务的劳动年龄界限,或因年老丧失劳.

entry.def: You say that someone is endowed with a particular desirable ability, characteristic, or possession when they have it by chance or by birth.

example.ex: You are endowed with wealth, good health and a lively intellect.
example.tran: 你生来就拥有财富、健康和活跃的思维。

entry.def: If you endow something with a particular feature or quality, you provide it with that feature or quality.

example.ex: Herbs have been used for centuries to endow a whole range of foods with subtle flavours.
example.tran: 数个世纪以来，香草一直被用于给各种食物增添淡淡的香味。

entry.tran: 资助，捐助(机构、奖学金、项目等)
entry.def: If someone endows an institution, scholarship, or project, they provide a large amount of money which will produce the income needed to pay for it.

example.ex: The ambassador has endowed a $1 million public-service fellowships program.
example.tran: 大使资助了一项100万美元的公共服务奖学金计划。

means.word_mean: 1. provided or supplied or equipped with (especially as by inheritance or nature);

sentences.sentence: "endowed by their Creator with certain unalienable rights"

auth_sentence.content: This Prof. Biddle has an endowed chair for sure.

auth_sentence.res_content: Six chairs are now endowed through the campaign.

auth_sentence.content: Leonardo da Vinci...Incredibly endowed both physically and mentally.
auth_sentence.res_content: Leonardo da Vinci...Incredibly endowed both physically and mentally.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Leonardo da Vinci...Incredibly endowed both physically and mentally.
